prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: B3-Carbon
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: We will measure the 12C/13C ratio using the HCN, and HCO+ molecules and their isotopologues.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We ask for line observations of HCN, H13CN, HCO+, and H13CO+, we used spectral average in all the lines, because we do not need high resolution. In the free baseband we added continuum sidebands. With the bandwidth that we selected of 4km/s we have a S/N ratio of 7.5 with is enough for detection purposes.

The target is 3 arcsec in size in the optical, but we expect it to be as much as three times bigger in the mm. The maximum scale is then 9 arcsec, and the components we want to resolve are not bigger than 1.2 arcsec in Band 3. We selected the configuration C36-3 that will give us the perfect combination.

We want to detect the HCN lines and their isotopologues. Recent observations showed the peak of the line to be a range from 1 to 13K, worst-case scenario if we set an rms of 0.2K we should be able to resolve the line to a S/N ratio of 5. For the sensitivity calculations we used the bandwidth of 4km/s, this is because we do not need to resolve the line.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: B6-Oxygen
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: We will measure the 18O/16O ratio using the H2O molecules and its isotopologues. In band 6 we can only see H2(18)O, we will use B7 to observe H2O.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We ask for line observations of H2(18)O, we used spectral average in all the lines, because we do not need high resolution. In the free baseband we added continuum sidebands. With the bandwidth that we selected of 6km/s we have a S/N ratio of a bit more than 3 with is enough for detection purposes.

The target is 3 arcsec in size in the optical, but we expect it to be as much as three times bigger in the mm. The maximum scale is then 7 arcsec, and the components we want to resolve are not bigger than 0.5 arcsec in Band 6. We selected the configuration C36-3 that will give us the perfect combination.

We want to detect the H2(18)O line. Recent observations showed the peak of the line to be a range from 0.8 to 6K, worst-case scenario if we set an rms of 0.1K we should be able to resolve the line to a S/N ratio of 6. For the sensitivity calculations we used the bandwidth of 4km/s, this is because we do not need to resolve the line.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: B7-Oxygen
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: We will measure the 18O/16O ratio using the H2O molecules and its isotopologues. In band 6 we can only see H2(18)O, we will use B7 to observe H2O.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We ask for line observations of H2O, we used spectral average in all the lines, because we do not need high resolution. In the free baseband we added continuum sidebands. With the bandwidth that we selected of 6km/s we have a S/N ratio of a bit more than 3 with is enough for detection purposes.

The target is 3 arcsec in size in the optical, but we expect it to be as much as three times bigger in the mm. The maximum scale is then 6 arcsec, and the components we want to resolve are not bigger than 0.5 arcsec in Band 7. We selected the configuration C36-3 that will give us the perfect combination.

We want to detect the H2O line. Recent observations showed the peak of the dimest line to be 3K, worst-case scenario if we set an rms of 0.5K we should be able to resolve the line to a S/N ratio of 7. For the sensitivity calculations we used the bandwidth of 4km/s, this is because we do not need to resolve the line.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: To resolve the question of the origin of dual chemistry in GBPNE, we propose to measure the 12C/13C and 16O/18O ratios using the HCN and H2O molecules and their isotopologues to determine the progenitor mass for a sample of 5 Galactic Bulge planetary nebulae (GBPNe); if we confirm them to be high mass objects, this will indicate that recent star formation event took place in the Galactic Bulge, with implications for our understanding of the evolution and enrichment of the Bulge.
